security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and troubleshooting workflows. No executable code, no network access, no malicious patterns detected. The skill provides diagnostic guidance and response patterns for an AI assistant.

content.value_statement: Technical problems stall development progress. This skill automatically diagnoses issues, identifies root causes, and guides resolution steps so developers can get back to building.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detect problems from user descriptions like 'not working' or 'error'
Run diagnostic commands to check environment, dependencies, and build status
Identify issue categories including dependency, type, build, runtime, and config errors
Guide users through LSP diagnostics for precise error location
Suggest appropriate fixes with user confirmation for destructive operations
Generate escalation reports for complex issues
limitations: Cannot fix issues that require manual server or infrastructure access
Cannot recover data from crashed systems without backup
May require user input for ambiguous or complex multi-step problems
Limited to JavaScript/TypeScript project troubleshooting patterns

use_cases.title: Learn to debug
use_cases.description: New developers learn systematic troubleshooting steps instead of guessing solutions

use_cases.title: Quick error resolution
use_cases.description: Experienced developers get fast diagnosis and targeted fixes for common issues

use_cases.title: AI-assisted problem solving
use_cases.description: Users without deep technical knowledge resolve issues through guided diagnosis

best_practices: Provide specific error messages and recent changes when describing problems
Confirm before running destructive commands like rm or git reset --hard
Use the dev-browser tool when available for UI/visual issues
anti_patterns: Running fix commands without understanding the root cause
Ignoring repeated failures and continuing without escalation
Skipping the diagnostic step and jumping straight to code changes

faq.question: What types of errors can this skill handle?
faq.answer: Handles dependency errors, type errors, build failures, runtime crashes, and configuration issues in JavaScript/TypeScript projects.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: It suggests fixes but always asks for confirmation before making changes, especially for destructive operations.

faq.question: Can it troubleshoot issues outside this project directory?
faq.answer: Limited to the current project. System-level issues or infrastructure problems require manual intervention.

faq.question: Is my code or data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs locally within your development environment using Read, Grep, and Bash tools only.

faq.question: What if the automated fixes do not work?
faq.answer: After 3 failed attempts, the skill escalates to human review with a detailed problem summary and attempted solutions.

faq.question: How is this different from using error recovery agents?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured diagnosis first, then applies targeted fixes. Error recovery agents typically jump straight to fixes.
